name: Bebe Barr
text:
Although going to court is nerve wracking, my overall experience was positive. My attorney, Parker Street, is excellent, and I can't thank him enough. The officers serving on court duty were so busy, but very congenial and quite nice. City Prosecutor, Mr Scoggings, was incredibly kind and considerate considering how my bad decisions didn't deserve it. Judge Hoyt runs his court with grace, tough love, congenial spirit and cares!
Finally, the ladies collecting fines and fees were also pleasant and patient with perkiness surprising for the long hours.
Thank you all for making an anxiety filled experience not horrible!
Sincerely,
Bebe Barr

name: Lillian Statton
text: I had to renew my drivers license recently and the ladies who helped me were extremely friendly and very helpful. I'll go to Sylacauga from now on.

name: Richard Morgan
text: Granddaughter received Bronze award in her Girl Scout troop.

name: Jason
text: Got a ticket and i wasn't in the wrong

name: Jonathan Gonzalez

name: Glady Titus
text: I'm giving 5 stars in hopes they won't take me to jail next time I deserve it. Please see this judge lynn bright

text: Got a speeding ticket. Was told to call them to sort it out. Have called about 20 times. No answer. Left a message each time as asked.... no answer.

name: Andrea Johnson
text:
It gets 2 stars because the bathroom was clean and there is adequate parking.

Do not go without a lawyer and bring your wallet!!!

I am a lifelong resident of Gardendale but after the 3 visits I made to that court room I am embarrassed to admit it. The whole system there needs to be re-evaluated it is so poorly ran and they know better. After every court date I felt the need to pray because I have never seen such a crooked setup and so many people getting screwed.
Shame on this city!

name: Darlene Winston
text: Gardendale Municipal Court is the most UNACCOMMODATING government establishment I have experienced.

name: shawana holmes
text: Aweful experience today.

name: Sirena Trujillo
text: never answer the phone keep adding more time to my waiting time

name: lexus pickett
text: Lady I spoke to about my speeding ticket was nice and helpful

name: J D
text: No trouble with them answering the phone. But i was trying to get court records and im currently out of state so.. i must mail in a money order (can't pay electronically) with my request then they said it could take a week to find my records (umm how unorganized are you..) then they can Fax them to me (not Email).. my experience with pascagoula MS court, has Great.. Records are free, i faxed in my request and the i called to ask if she could email them to me vs faxing them. she said Yes.. That is SOOO convenient in a process you do not want to take long. Why cant Mobile offer Free records or E-pay and Emailing of the scanned copies, so inconvenient and frustrating to deal with, i wouldn't cost much to integrate E-pay, then just allow copies to be scanned and email and problem solved = people happy

name: Anthony Jackson
text: I got a speeding ticket that took well over 2 months for them to make it payable. That’s pathetic

A place of business especially a court should not have a none working phone, please fix...

College football but cant afford to have someone picking up the phone for minimum wage it's sad in 2018

text: Judge Allred gave my kids to my ex wife who let my child quit school at age 12. I had my children for 6 years before that . She had run off and left me and the kids but I was the bad parent.  That's what good decisions he can make. I even tried calling his office to tell him about the situation but he wouldn't take my call. Walker County really needs someone like him here. I say vote him OUT!

text: What a courthouse! I have never seen a courtroom where people who work there use cell phones and just cut up laughing. The guy who sits beside the clerk just has his foam cup sitting there pulling his mask up and im sure it was dip he spit in there. U don't have a chance winning a traffic ticket without having a lawyer. Seems like they all know each other pretty good!!!!!

name: Chris Wright
text: They don’t answer the phone when you call and need information

name: Tanner Brasher
text: They never answer the phone. I’ve called multiple times and at different times of the day. I have a ticket that needs to be payed by July 2nd and I have no idea how much it cost because they never answer the phones.

name: Tia Harding
text: Worse municipal court in History. They are never here when they say they will be. You have to call multiple times to get a response. When you leave a message they never call you back. Try your best to never get a ticket in Oxford al. They will happily give a warrant for your arrest but never are there for you when you try to do the right thing and pay your ticket.

name: Jade Kolendra
text: They told me I could send the money in the mail, and I wouldn't have to show up on the 28th. A week later, I got a post card stating a warrant was issued for my arrest! Its the 17th! And to top it off, I can't get anyone to answer the phones, ever!

name: Jack Gilbert
text: They take care of you if you have fines to pay.

name: Jeremiah Von Wolfsblood
text: They never answer the phone

name: Bigger Best
text: No website and I've called 100 times no Awnser

name: hydra1
text:
The address on the citation took me here, the officer that pulled me over neglected to mention fines are no longer paid at city hall.

For those of you who try to be on time for everything, this is for you: 300 cain street, that'll take you where you need to go to pay a fine or sign up for traffic school. I hope that helps, it was a major pain getting directions from strangers.

name: Ryan Hart
text:
This system is corrupt and all they care about are their conviction ratings. First, let's start with how incompetent the prosecutor and the judge are. The prosecutor gets all angry and acts like she is mad at the world when you simply try to defend yourself. There was a gentleman who went to her before me and he stated that he was under the impression that if the officer didn't show for the trial that the case should be dismissed, I have been told this throughout my years as well. After telling the prosecutor this, she gets all irrate and replied, yea, I'm just going to call in this officer out there doing his job, protecting the city, blah blah blah, in such a disrespectful and angry manner, basically trying to make the defendant feel guilty. It's like yes, you are suppose to have the officer there  for the trial. Now that being said, how come the officer who wrote me a ticket wasn't there? Oh he changed shifts so we have to reschedule your trial was the answer I got .What if that officer had a night shift? Would he not be expected to show then? You are so incompetent you didn't know he changed shifts before my trial and not setting the trial according to when the officer would be there? I'm missing work days and getting this stress put on me for no good reason. Sat in that court room for all those hours basically for nothing because this system is so broke and needs to be replaced by people more competent for the job.
Now for the judge himself, there was a lady there for her son that was being held in another state and when the judge called her sons name she answered him and the judge stated that he would get to her shortly. 3 hours or so passed and the officer had to remind the judge about the lady and the judge is 'like oh I'm sorry, come on up here ma'am. What a joke.
Now it's my turn to talk to the judge, after sitting there for 4 hours or so, basically for nothing. I tell him that it is unfair, I haven't missed any of my court dates and I'm under the impression if the officer isn't there for the trial, the case should be dismissed. Note that I am driving all that way from Huntsville and missing a days work. He replies to me, I'm sorry, I'm sure you read online the officers don't show to court but they do. I replied with yes, and that's what should have happened today. He replies again I'm sorry, I know this is an inconvenience but there is nothing we can do. He tells me that I'm only dealing with one case and he is dealing with 70. Well guess what? That is your job. That is what you chose to do with your life. You doing a poor job at it or not is beyond me and you shouldn't use it as an excuse against me.
This is the corrupt incompetent system deciding the fate of human lives. God help Decatur.

name: Matthew “Matt S”
text: Got my marriage license here. Small and easy. Love it.

name: David Goodwin
text: I like to believe they are fair or at least that's what they leed you to believe bring money. Overall I've seen worse alot worse

name: Michael Hamilton
text: I'v paid my fare share of fines here, but they are centrally located in downtown Decatur and the staff in all of the office that I dealt with are courteous and professional.

name: George Dugger
text: The staff here are doing all the stuff right in these strange times

name: Pamela Frasure
text: Went in to get my fishing license and the lady who does them was at lunch and no one bothered to tell me.

name: Ashley Wiersma
text: Hardly ever a wait and I usually receive friendly service

name: Alura Young
text:
I had 5 different interactions there today. One woman didn't even have to help but did and I thought that was super nice.
One lady (window 10 I think it was) had an attitude towards me because I walked up to the wrong window. Maybe she needs a day off or 5. 😂

name: Maggie Wright
text: New system gets you in and out

name: Alisha Black
text: Clean, courteous service

name: Darrell Flores
text: Friendly,courteous, efficient staff.

name: Aakayla
text: I had a $25 citation and called before the day of court to pay the ticket and they said it was $227. Why do I have to pay court fees on something that I was going to pay without going to court... I went to court which was suppose to start at nine o clock am. Officers didn't come to call us til 9:08. At about 9:12 we went in to court. I go to court to plead guilty to the $25 ticket and they still made me pay the $202 court fee, which yes I understand because I went to court to try to distribute about the extra $202. Which they were going to make me pay regardless of if I went to court or not. I go to pay for the ticket and the lady up there says "Let me recall her warrant," then she started to take my payment. WHY WOULD U PUT A WARRANT OUT ON SOMEONE THAT'S IN COURT TALKING TO THE JUDGE! ALSO STILL WHY WOULD I HAVE TO PAY A COURT FEE WHEN I WAS TRYING TO PAY THE TICKET DAYSS BEFORE COURT??

name: Art Of Valor
text: Fair and reasonable court system. They try to work with people.

name: Murl Sowell
text: They treat our court reporters very rudely and unprofessional on entrance.  I can't imagine how they treat the public, especially not answering the phone.  Court Reporters have to have their cell phones in order to be in contact with the court reporting firm and lawyers.  These rules must be changed and the Administrator and Judges need to be aware of these employees treating people so badly.

name: Destiny Bean
text: Worst customer service I have ever experienced. They never answer the phone so if ur trying to call don't waste your time.

name: Nora Swedenburg
text:
I found the people to be helpful and concerned. Judge Westry was professional and helpful taking time to answer questions. He and his assistants are there with a tough job. Let’s face it, no one plans to go Municipal Court on purpose. I appreciate the care given in a tough time.
Thank you!

name: Jj Smart
text: Justice Center should be removed from the name of this building. I truly believe that many of the corruption and crime problems in city are a result of the rulings of this court.

name: UnbiasedReport
text: My experience here wasn't really that bad. I was led on a wild goose chase when I had a bad experience with a cop. They did tell me that I needed to get more information and wouldn't tell me who it was that I was involved in an incident with. Aside from that, I can't really entirely say it's their fault. It's the police department's fault so I had to return back there. When I spoke to the magistrate to give my story, he seemed interested in what I was talking about and professional. The woman magistrate did as well.

name: Quincie Carrasco
text: This establishment needs to be gutted and restaffed , answering simple questions must be hard for the pea brained employees that work here . Very quick to charge people for crimes and money and very slow to tell you why. I would rather speak to a robot who has more sense and less attitude. Sorry to anyone who has to deal with this!!!

name: Krystle Moore
text: The WORSTTTTTTTTTT customer service i have ever experienced in my life. Not only is the phone automated system the worst set up when or IF you finally reach someone they are RUDE. All i wanted to do was pay a ticket. its been three days of me waiting on hold just to get hung up on. I live in a different state now and have no other way to settle this other then over their raggedy ass phones!!  this is UNBELIEVABLE.

name: DERRICK UNIVERSITY
text: I wish people were more professional. Please keep your receipts in your car and make copies. They don't update your records. You can be arrested for the same tickets.

name: Maddison Williams
text: This place is a joke I keep calling them trying to get my tickets sorted out and everytime the system hangs up on me when I’m waiting to be connected with someone. How am I supposed to pay a ticket if I’m from out of state if no one will pick up the damn phones. I’ve been trying for a week now. I’d give them no stars if I could.

name: Queen M
text: I paid an innumerable amount of money to pay off tickets, 10 YEARS ago. These people literally have NO RECORD of my payments and now want me to come to their city and state to pay all of it AGAIN!! They don’t want to tell you ANYTHING over the phone, after telling them countless of times you don’t even live in the state. The entire staff is rude and act like they’re chickens with their heads cut off

name: Anissa Perkins
text: HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE. No one EVER answers the phone! Would give 0 stars if I could!

name: Shanequa Moore
text: I CALLED THESE FOLKS LAST YEAR &HERE IT IS 2018 &IM STILL HOLDING THE PHONE WAITING FOR SOMEONE TO PICK UP! NO ONE EVER ANSWER OR THE PHONE IS BEING HUNG UP/DISCONNECTED CONSTANTLY!!!! GIVE ME A JOB AT ANSWERING THE PHONES BECAUSE THE ONES THERE WORKING ARE HORRIBLE!!!!!!

name: MNML KICKS (MNMLKICKS)
text: Nobody there has an idea what's going on. You hear one thing from one person and something completely else from someone else.

name: Ameerah Singleton
text: The worst place I’ve ever been customer service is awful and they will charge you for the stupidest thing.

name: Alexus Moody
text: THEY NEVER ANSWER THE PHONE !!! HORRIBLE CUSTOMER SERVICE!!!

name: Gary Gurley
text: Wanna talk to someone over the phone when you choose that option right? Nope. 3 prompts later.. No results. Went up there.. Flies were everywhere and the people who worked there were very rude.

name: Temia Hayes
text: Don’t answer phone

name: Jordan White
text: So unprofessional need to be put out of business

name: Autumn Thrasher
text: Fair. Judge Westry is a fair, amazing and reasonable man who understands hard times and mistakes we make as God's children.

name: Victoria Rudolph
text: I agree it's the worst experience ever going there especially your very first initial entrance and the bailiff (Christopher) it's the worst even if you're there getting information!

name: Lamar Hatcher
text: Pay tickets off a year ago but they haven’t sent a clearance letter to the dmv in Montgomery yet so I’m still without license

name: Malisa Hicklen
text: Whenever I come here to handle my business I have great service very professional staff 🌹

name: David Mckee
text: They never answer the phone, services are very poor.

name: MagicCityKitty
text: I recently took my sister to traffic court in May.  It was one of those 95 degree days, not a cloud in the sky, and the sun was brutal.  Court took longer than expected, and after a while I asked if I could step outside for a couple of minutes, and come back in - I was told "Yes, of course" by a lady in the courtroom.  Well, it was a couple of minutes after 5:00 when I tried to come back in, and the door was locked.  The man working the front opened the door long enough to tell me they were closed and I could not come back in - and that was that - he shut the door.  I was very surprised, and not happy, but what could I do?  I saw a spot of shade by the exit door, and walked over to lean on the wall in the shade.  The man came out and told me I could not stand there - I had to wait in the parking lot.  I broiled in my car with the door open for the next 20 minutes until my sister came out.  My vehicle uses a lot of gas, and I can't afford to leave it running with the air on.  I shouldn't HAVE to!! Very bad treatment,  IMHO. I don't know if this was a decision he made on his own, or if it's something he's been instructed to do by his superiors - but it needs to change either way!

name: Omar Ali
text: Here to server the people

name: Paris A
text: Horrible staff very rude very lazy they treat you like you murdered someone because of a traffic ticket

name: Jean Jett
text:
This is the rudest bunch of people. I called for a week before anyone ever answered the phone. I knew the ticket number and asked how much my daughter owes. I was told she has to come in.  She goes in stands in the clerks line the following after noon, gives the lady her picture is and  information.  The clerk has neen asked at this point how much the ticket is twice. Still no answer. The clerk begins rattling off 5 more tickets that listed under my daughters name. Again how much do I owe. This continues until my daughter is beginning to get upset. So I try and get the amount from the clerk. She told me to get behind the white line and refuses to speak to me.  We left there still have no idea how much she owes
All know to do is call DMV and they tell us the same ticket we thought she owed for and NO OTHERS. Mailed a money order for what we find out the ticket would be in jefferdon county. 10 days later get a paper back stating she needs to come back in to set up a payment plan. We get no receipt for the money order or the $400 THEY received. This is a nightmare. Guess next step is an attorney!!  Never in my life have I ever had to beg a place to take money or tell me what I owe for something.

name: Patricia Wall
text: Very bad experience...no way to clear up my misdemeanor case without going to Birmingham from Florida and bringing $300 with me. CRAZY!!

name: Joe See
text: This has to be the laziest fattest bunch of city workers in the state. God forbid you ask for some assistance while you’re in there! If you hate what you do go get another job!

name: Christopher Calvin Reid
text: The Judges and prosecutors are some of the best attorneys in alabama. They try to balance justice with mercy and despite the criticism they get from some in the community they do an excellent job with limited resources. I have worked in some rural places and it seemed like the only thing that mattered was bringing in money but Birmingham actually works with people who struggle to pay and shows a lot of grace. The staff that works there does a good job with the limited resources and everytime I have had an issue or a problem they took extra time to be helpful and truly went above and beyond to fix any error. If people would just treat the court personnel with kindness and respect they would have such an easier time. But I have seen people yell at judges, cause disruptions etc. and each time it was the court personnel who showed restraint and calmness.

name: Josh B
text: Took an acquaintance to their court date; wasn't actually there for myself.  Front end staff is very loose except with the people that are there for court.  I observed more than one person set off the metal detector, walk in with bags, all the while the lady that was supposed to be checking them just disregarded it.  Evidently, if you know the person up front you can walk right through without second glance.  Court was running behind so I had to wait around 10-20min which is understandable, not everything always goes as planned.  Went through security after being thoroughly checked myself and to the court room.  The court room had changed from what was posted; again, not a big deal, we got to the right place.  Bailiff came around signing the folks in and then tells me I have to leave.  Ok, why isn't it posted?  I left and waited out front.  Had to sit on the ground because they're to cheap to provide a couple benches or a proper waiting area.  After waiting over an HOUR the person I took came out and said "The judge isn't in; I have a new court date."  Needless to say, this venture was an utter waste of time and a total disappointment in dealing with our "justice" system.  Don't forget to pay for your parking token! (ProTip: The token machine is permanently out of order; see the clerk before you leave security!)

name: NIYA BEST
text: dang yall harsh

name: Mrz Perry
text: The security at the desk are rather rude... Like we get it. U don't want to be here. But SOME of us were pulled over by officer dumb a** with cotton in his ears forced me to take a day off work to b here my dang self so I suggest yall grin and bear it like I have to! 😤 Then I get in the courtroom, the judge calls my name. Says, Thank you Ms. Perry. Have a great day, your case is dismissed." The grin on the way out was MUCH more sincere than the one yall got coming in. I politely paid for my tokens, and drove away into the sunset. Lol.

name: lisa ragland
text: I called Birmingham Municipal Court and had a very pleasant experience with a young lady named Brigitte. She was very friendly and professional.

name: JULIAN HICKS
text: JULIAN  HICKS NOT SO GOOD SOME THINK JUST CAUSE THEY HAVE A COLLEGE EDUCATION IT'S  THEIR WAY OR THE HIGH WAY, SEE THAT SOCIAL SECURITY ADMINISTRATION AND NO DIRECT DEPOSIT AND THEM RIGHT THEIR NOT GOING TO GIVING ME NOR RESTRAINING ORDER ALONG WITH SOME OTHERS ARE GOING TO CAUSE ME TO HIT THE WITH OUT ANY WARRANTS ARE GOING TO CAUSE TO HIT ME TO HIT THE HWY PART FOUR. IF THE AFRICANS WHERE REALLY PAYING ANY ATTENTION , AND YOU HOPE THIS DOE S NOT MULTIPLY THIS IS SLAVERY AGAIN.

name: princess Henderson
text: I Just talked to a lady Named Clara who is supposed to be a supervisor and she has helped me before but for some reason when ppl are in a bad mood, everyone gets treated badly. I don't know the mean ppl are placed in the high positions. The service in the courthouse sucks and I'm being double charged for one ticket. Thumbs DOWN!

name: Dalton Harris
text: Very horrible service. You call to find information out all day the phone just rings and no one picks up the phone. Go straight to the voicemail. Just horrible.

name: Kavan ogletree
text: It teaches them accountability

name: Daniel Super
text: Rude people
